meanings.definition: Persuading someone not to take a particular course of action.
meanings.sent1: She was dissuading her friend from skipping school.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was dissuading the students from cheating on the test.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was dissuading the cat from climbing the tree.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds dissuaded the beachgoers from swimming in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The warning signs dissuaded hikers from entering the dangerous area.

meanings.sent1: He tried dissuading his brother from eating too much candy.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was dissuading his patient from smoking.
meanings.sent3: The clown dissuaded the children from being afraid with funny tricks.
meanings.sent4: The bright lights dissuaded the moths from flying too close.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise dissuaded the birds from nesting in the tree.
